org.anarres.dhcp.common.address

Class AddressUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.anarres.dhcp.common.address.AddressUtils

  • public class AddressUtils
extends Object
    General purpose address manipulation routines. All methods are big-endian (network-endian) and modify their arguments.
    See Also:
    InetAddresses

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AddressUtils()

      • toInetAddress

        @Nonnull
public static InetAddress toInetAddress(@Nonnull
                                byte[] data)
        Constructs an InetAddress from the given byte array. This is equivalent to InetAddress.getByAddress(byte[]) but throws only unchecked exceptions.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the underlying routine throws UnknownHostException.

      • toNetworkAddress

        @Nonnull
public static byte[] toNetworkAddress(@Nonnull
                              byte[] in,
                              @Nonnegative
                              int netmask)
        Zeros out all but the first netmask bits of in. This routine modifies its argument and returns it.

      • toNetworkMask

        @Nonnull
public static byte[] toNetworkMask(@Nonnegative
                           int addressLength,
                           @Nonnegative
                           int netmask)
        Constructs an address suitable for use as a mask. The return value is a big-endian byte array of the specified length. The high netmask bits will be 1 and the remaining low bits will be 0. For example, the address may be of the form 255.255.240.0 or ff:ff:fc:....

      • toNetworkMaskAddress

        @Nonnull
public static InetAddress toNetworkMaskAddress(@Nonnegative
                                       int addressLength,
                                       @Nonnegative
                                       int netmask)

      • toNetworkMaskAddress

        @Nonnull
public static InetAddress toNetworkMaskAddress(@Nonnull
                                       InetAddress in,
                                       @Nonnegative
                                       int netmask)
        Constructs a companion netmask address to the given InetAddress.
        See Also:
        toNetworkMask(int, int)

      • toNetmask

        @Nonnegative
public static int toNetmask(@Nonnull
                        byte[] netmaskAddress)
        Converts an address of the form 255.255.240.0 into an CIDR netmask.
